text: Stop Brexit
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Every vote for the Liberal Democrats is a vote to stop Brexit and stay in the European Union.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: For over three years Liberal Democrats have led the fight to stop Brexit.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We campaigned to stay in the EU in 2016 and we unequivocally believe that the UK is stronger as part of the EU.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: The election of a Liberal Democrat majority government on a clear stop Brexit platform will provide a democratic mandate to stop this mess, revoke Article 50 and stay in the EU.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: In other circumstances, we will continue to fight for a people’s vote with the option to stay in the EU,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and in that vote we would passionately campaign to keep the UK in the EU.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Electing a Liberal Democrat government is the only way to get the Brexit process over.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Although the Conservatives claim that a vote for them will ‘get Brexit done’, it won’t:
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: it will simply usher in more years of difficult negotiations over the UK’s trade deal with the EU, with a very high chance of Britain crashing out and trying to survive on so-called ‘WTO terms’ – a deal so bad that almost no other country anywhere in the world trades on that basis.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Labour want to reopen the Withdrawal Agreement all over again and negotiate a new deal – but they will not say whether they want Britain to remain in the EU or leave.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: The fact is that whether Labour Red or Tory Blue, Brexit is bad for the UK.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: The importance of the UK’s membership of the EU has never been clearer.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Working together through the EU, the countries of Europe have achieved peace and prosperity on a continent historically wracked by war and division.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: That is a tremendous achievement; it should not be taken for granted, particularly as Europe faces new dangers from an increasingly aggressive Russia and as the US turns away from its old alliances.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Many of the great challenges of the 21st century are global: climate change, human trafficking, the arms trade, the power of multinationals, global poverty and inequality.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: By separating itself from the EU, Britain diminishes its capacity to respond to these threats.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: By working together with our European neighbours, we increase the UK’s ability to meet those challenges: for example, in international negotiations, in regulating the tech giants or in creating markets for climate-friendly products.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: There is no doubt that full membership of the EU is good for the British economy.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Brexit would bring to an end businesses’ unfettered access to the European single market – the destination of almost half of Britain’s exports – and to the smooth flow of goods that complex industrial supply chains require.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: The prospect of tariffs and border checks is already causing manufacturers to shift their operations to other EU states and UK manufacturers are already reporting that export orders have dried up.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: There is no prospect of replacing lost EU markets with free trade agreements with other countries thousands of miles away.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: If the UK gives in to President Trump’s demands to lower environmental and health standards for a trade deal with the US, we would lose the ability to export to the EU,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: which would drive many British businesses, including most farmers, out of business.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Brexit is bad for jobs,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: growth and prosperity.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Brexit will also mean an end to freedom of movement, which has brought the UK tremendous social, economic and cultural benefits.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: It gives British people the opportunity to work, be together with their loved ones, study and retire anywhere in the EU.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: There is no contradiction between our European and our British, national and regional identities: they enrich one another.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: By stopping Brexit, Liberal Democrats will protect and maintain freedom of movement, safeguarding the rights of UK citizens living elsewhere in the EU and EU citizens in the UK.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Liberal Democrats will also support the right of the people of Gibraltar to remain in the European Union.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: EU citizens are valued members of our communities and we believe that they should be afforded the right to full participation in civic life, including the ability to stand for office and vote in UK referendums, European elections and general elections as well as local elections.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Liberal Democrats will extend these rights to all EU citizens who have lived in the UK for five years or longer.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: To ensure that EU citizens are not denied their vote in any election or referendum, we will also implement urgent electoral law reform, in line with the Electoral Commission’s 2014 recommendations,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: including introducing a legal requirement for councils to inform citizens of the steps they must take to be successfully registered
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and making the necessary changes to ensure that the UK has an automatic system of inclusion in elections.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: The national humiliation of Brexit puts so much at risk – the NHS, public services, jobs across the country, scientific collaboration, peace in Northern Ireland, the unity of the UK, our ability to tackle global crises such as climate change and our global reputation as a country that is confident and outward-facing.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: By keeping the UK in the EU, we can get on with tackling the real issues facing our country,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Liberalism and cooperation have a vital role to play in securing peace,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: promoting democracy
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and defending human rights across the world.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: But the rules-based international order that has governed international relations for the past 70 years is under threat.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: The Liberal Democrats are the only party that is looking forward: neither the Conservatives nor Labour have a convincing vision of the UK’s role in the world.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We will build on the UK’s proud record of international leadership through the EU, UN, NATO and the Commonwealth by promoting values of freedom and opportunity for all.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: It has never been more important for the UK to work with allies as a champion of this message.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We will: Champion the liberal, rules-based international order, which provides a strong basis for multilateral action to address the world’s biggest problems.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Use all aspects of government policy – trade, aid and diplomacy
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: as well as military cooperation –
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: to strengthen UK efforts to prevent violent conflict.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Increase overseas financial support for the ongoing refugee crisis, focussing on countries that have accepted millions of refugees.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Work with European partners to introduce a European Magnitsky Act that would enable sanctions against corrupt individuals and perpetrators of human rights abuses.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Improve control of arms exports, including by introducing a policy of ‘presumption of denial’ for arms exports to countries listed as Human Rights Priority Countries in the Foreign and Commonwealth Office’s annual human rights report.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Liberal Democrats believe that despite efforts to prevent violent conflict, sometimes military intervention is necessary.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: The UK should only intervene militarily when there is a clear legal or humanitarian case, endorsed by a vote in parliament
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: – working through international institutions whenever possible.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We will encourage dialogue and mediation to reduce conflict between and within countries, working through the UN and other agencies.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: In response to current crises, we will: Legislate to ensure there is a parliamentary vote before engaging in military action,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: while preserving the ability to engage in action in emergencies or under treaty obligation without requiring parliamentary approval.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Focus on the diplomatic priorities of the UN’s Responsibility to Protect doctrine
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and establish new tests to ensure that any UK action has regional support,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: a reasonable prospect of defined success,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and a sound legal and humanitarian case.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Work with international partners to tackle violent extremism, paying special attention to UK citizens who have fought overseas for terrorist organisations who may become significant sources of terrorist activity if they return to Britain.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: On Syria, cooperate internationally to stabilise the region and provide humanitarian assistance.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Work with the EU to revive the Iran nuclear deal.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Officially recognise the independent state of Palestine, condemn violence on all sides of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and support Israel’s right to security.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We remain committed to a negotiated peace settlement, which includes a two-state solution.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Suspend UK arms sales to Saudi Arabia in response to their consistent targeting of civilians, in breach of international humanitarian law, in Yemen.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Promote democracy and stability in Ukraine and neighbouring countries against an increasingly aggressive Russia,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: by working closely with the EU and international partners to exert maximum economic and political pressure,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and standing by our NATO treaty obligations.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Honour our legal and moral duty to the people of Hong Kong by reopening the British National Overseas Passport offer, extending the scheme to provide the right to abode to all holders.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: A Secure Defence in the 21st Century
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: The Armed Forces play a vital role in the defence of the nation: government should have a deep sense of duty to properly support service personnel and veterans.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Neither the Conservatives nor Labour have shown a commitment to this:
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: the Conservative government in particular has spread chronic low morale, misspent money on vanity projects and failed to recruit and retain people with the skills needed for 21st century warfare.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Liberal Democrats are the only party who understand the new challenges faced by the Armed Forces and who are committed to properly supporting them.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We will: Commit to the principle of collective self-defence as laid out in the North Atlantic Treaty and spending two per cent of GDP on defence in line with NATO recommendations:
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: as the economy grows after we have stopped Brexit, this will mean an extra £3 billion over the parliament.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Strengthen our armed services and address critical skills shortages by recruiting STEM graduates to be armed forces engineers, providing ‘golden handshakes’ of up to £10,000.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Promote an international treaty on the principles and limits of the use of technology in modern warfare.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Recognise the expansion of warfare into the cybersphere by investing in our security and intelligence services and acting to counter cyberattacks.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Maintain a minimum nuclear deterrent,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: while pursuing multilateral nuclear disarmament:
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: continuing with the Dreadnought programme, the submarine- based replacement for Vanguard, but procuring three boats and moving to a medium-readiness responsive posture and maintaining the deterrent through measures such as unpredictable and irregular patrolling patterns.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Support the Armed Forces Covenant and ongoing work to support veterans’ mental health.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Improve the quality of housing for service personnel by bringing the Ministry of Defence into line with other landlords, giving tenants the same legal rights to repair and maintenance as private tenants.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Trade, Aid and Investment
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: The liberal, international rules-based order has created peace and prosperity: trade has helped millions out of poverty and to live longer, healthier lives.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: But the system is imperfect and must improve to tackle global inequalities: gender inequality remains widespread
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and the climate crisis will disproportionately impact the poorest people and poorest countries.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Liberal Democrats are the only party with a vision for the future based on championing liberalism:
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: the Conservatives are inward-looking and nationalist and committed to leaving the EU, the biggest champion of the liberal order in our part of the world;
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour spring to the defence of authoritarian regimes in Venezuela and Iran,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: while failing to fight to stop Brexit.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Our plan for the future is built on championing liberal and international values,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: ending poverty
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and promoting the UN Sustainable Development Goals both in the UK and abroad.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We will: Remain firmly committed to spending 0.7 per cent of Gross National Income on aid,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: prioritising development that both helps the poorest and ties in with our strategic international objectives on gender equality,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: climate change and the environment,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: human rights,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: conflict prevention
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and tackling inequality.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Increase the proportion of the aid budget committed to tackling climate change and environmental degradation:
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: helping countries mitigate the impact of climate change and other environmental crises
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and support climate refugees.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Pursue a foreign agenda with gender equality at its heart, focusing on: the transformation of the position of women through economic inclusion, education and training;
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: ensuring the lives of women and girls are not ignored in favour of trade or regional alliances;
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: working to extend reproductive rights and end female genital mutilation;
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and ending sexual violence in conflict zones.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Protect, defend, and promote human rights for all, including LGBT+ individuals who are persecuted across the world as well as those persecuted for their religion or belief.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Develop a global education strategy to address the urgent crisis of 263 million children missing out on schooling.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Work through international bodies for better regulation and scrutiny of international trade and investment treaties to ensure they do not worsen inequalities
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: or undermine human rights
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: or developing countries’ ability to regulate the environmental and social impacts of businesses.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Champion global anti-corruption initiatives and ensure the UK and British Overseas Territories have publicly-accessible registers of beneficial ownership of companies registered in their jurisdictions.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Promoting Human Rights and Equality Around the World
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Human rights are global.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: An individual’s liberty should be equally respected wherever they live.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: However, as authoritarian regimes trample over freedom of speech and belief and LGBT+ and other people are continuing to suffer discrimination, this is far from being the case.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Liberal Democrats are the only party capable of renewing international liberalism and combatting discrimination:
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: the Conservatives’ Brexit will mean prioritising trade deals over people’s rights
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and Labour cannot hope to tackle discrimination abroad when they cannot even root out anti-Semitism in their own party.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We are the only party with a credible plan to enhance the UK’s soft power and to use it to promote human rights
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and democracy around the world.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We will: Require UK-registered NGOs and organisations including the Armed Forces and defence contractors to report all instances of documented abuse overseas to government – reviewing, reducing, or refusing funding to organisations found in breach of these rules.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Establish an easy and appropriate reporting mechanism for abuse that makes clear that reporters and whistleblowers will not be discriminated against for reporting abuse.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Support free media and a free and open internet, championing the free flow of information.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Support the current UN initiative to protect journalists – combatting the impunity granted to those who attack reporters on the frontline – by funding UNESCO’s International Programme for the Development of Communication.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Work to abolish the death penalty around the world
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and remove the power of ministers to allow security and justice assistance in cases that could result in its use.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Work to end the use of torture around the world
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and conduct a full inquiry into the UK Government’s involvement in torture and rendition.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Develop proposals with the BBC for investment to grow the World Service to reach more people across the world with independent and trusted news
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and continue to support BBC Monitoring and the British Council.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Develop a comprehensive strategy for promoting the decriminalisation of homosexuality around the world
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and advancing LGBT+ rights.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Appoint an Ambassador-level Champion for Freedom of Belief.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Global Climate Action Now
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: The climate emergency is a global challenge and requires a global solution.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: However, with the US withdrawing from the Paris Agreement and with most national climate policies falling well short of the Agreement’s ambition to limit the global temperature rise to 1.5°C, this global solution looks a long way off.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Neither the Conservatives nor Labour have a plan to tackle this: the Conservatives have given no real thought to the climate emergency, and Labour are only interested in repeating empty slogans.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Liberal Democrats are the only party with a detailed plan to lead global efforts to combat the climate emergency.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We will: Support the Paris Agreement by playing a leadership role in international efforts to combat climate change,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: demonstrating commitment by rapidly reducing emissions from the UK economy,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: increasing development spending on climate objectives
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and aiming to persuade all countries to commit to net zero climate goals by the 2020 UN climate conference in Glasgow.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Use our role in the EU to tackle the climate emergency, by setting a binding, EU-wide net zero target of 2050,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and continuing to take part in the EU’s Internal Energy Market, to provide access to clean energy sources while keeping costs low.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Strengthen climate and environmental goals in EU trade and investment agreements
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and refuse to enter any trade agreements with countries that have policies counter to the Paris Agreement, including the Mercosur-EU free trade agreement because of the Brazilian government’s actions in the Amazon.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Initiate negotiations within the UN for a legally binding international treaty on plastics reduction.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Argue for ambitious new legally binding international targets to protect global biodiversity,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and an effective global oceans treaty to create a network of ocean sanctuaries.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: We will also provide greater resources for international environmental cooperation, particularly on actions to tackle illegal and unsustainable trade in timber,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: wildlife,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: ivory,
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and fish.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: Argue for an end to all fossil fuel subsidies world-wide
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future

text: and provide aid to developing countries to help them transition to clean sources of energy.
title: Stop Brexit build a brighter future
